text: The FIBA Oceania Under-17 Championship is an under-17 basketball championship in the International Basketball Federation's FIBA Oceania zone. Since 2017, the competition previously known as FIBA Oceania Under-18 Championship, which was a qualifier for the FIBA Under-19 Basketball World Cup, is now an under-17 competition for Oceania teams to qualify to the FIBA Asia Under-18 Championship (from which they can then qualify for the World Cup). ==Summary== === Oceania Under-18 Championship === {| class=wikitable style="text- align:center; font-size:90%; width:80%" |+Summaries !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !rowspan=2 width=10%|Host !width=1% rowspan=10| !colspan=3|Final !width=1% rowspan=10| !colspan=3|Bronze medal game |- !width=10%|Gold !width=10%|Score !width=10%|Silver !width=10%|Bronze !width=6.5%|Score !width=10%|Fourth place |- style="background:#D0E6FF;" |2002 Details | Sydney |'''''' |2–0 78–55 / 112–50 | |bgcolor=#efefef rowspan=4 colspan=3|No other teams competed |- |2008 Details | Adelaide |'''''' |3–0 94–67 / 84–71 / 81–60 | |- style="background:#D0E6FF;" |2010 Details | Palmerston North |'''''' |3–0 109–82 / 107–51 / 94–46 | |- |2012 Details | Porirua |'''''' |3–0 85–64 / 95–70 / 93–60 | |- style="background:#D0E6FF;" |2014 Details | Suva |'''''' |84–81 | | |63–56 | |- ||2016 Details | Suva |'''''' |57–51 | | |87–68 | |} === Oceania Under-17 Championship === {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center; font-size:90%; width:80%" |+Summaries !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !rowspan=2 width=10%|Host !width=1% rowspan=10| !colspan=3|Final !width=1% rowspan=10| !colspan=3|Bronze medal game |- !width=10%|Gold !width=10%|Score !width=10%|Silver !width=10%|Bronze !width=6.5%|Score !width=10%|Fourth place |- style="background:#D0E6FF;" |2017 Details | Hagåtña |'''''' |93–55 | | |105–70 | |- style="background:#D0E6FF;" |- ||2019 Details | Nouméa |'''''' |85–56 | | |87–59 | |} ==Performances by nation== ==Participation details== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font- size:90%" ! width=170|Nation ! 2002 !! 2008 !! 2010 !! 2012 !! 2014 !! 2016 !! 2017 !! 2019 !!
